body: The longer you play, the more the game introduces making it harder and more complicated. I've played the game for the better part of today (7/23) and I will say that so far I have been enjoying it thoroughly, even being stuck playing with random strangers and no communication. It's easy enough that you don't necessarily need communication although believe me it helps. The further you progress the more types of baddies the game introduces, and the harder and stronger they become. The skill tree becomes increasingly larger and slightly more confusing the more you level up, and I will say the thing I have been annoyed with the most is the lack of clear description or explanation for a lot of game mechanics, specifically having to do with survivors, squads and other such things you deal with in the menus. BUT, to be fair, SOME things I've given up in confusion on get explained just a few story missions later. Has a great feature that allows to rejoin ongoing game if your game crashes.
title: Fun, repetitive, gets harder as you progress

body: The game starts out fun, with loads of characters, skills, weapons and the ability to build your own bases. Problem being that after about mission 3, you realize that you're going to be playing the same few missions over and over again to make small gains for loads of work, which you'll want to bring friends with to play with you, as every mission is incredibly boring, but, both of those qualities are a little more forgivable on a free to play model. In addition, as with every early access game, it's really buggy and sometimes the connection becomes so unstable that it is unplayable. This game is also bogged down by the f2p model of paying to progress and having good gear and equipment hidden behind loot boxes. So, the TL;DR, wait until it's free to play, as the game is built as a free to play, with all of the annoyances of that model in the paid version.
title: Save your money, wait for free to play

body: While the game combines several familiar and common elements from so many games - Epic Games has pull it off in a way that makes this game truely feel and play like an innovative one-of-a-kind orginal! On the fence, I initially spent a few hours reading early alpha reviews and other posts prior to buying the Limited Edition Founders Pack; afterwards I can say with the bonus loot and game keys for friends it was money well spent! My friends and I are now having a blast after rotating on and off of so many other games. This game really offers something for everyone and has it all! The building customization, hero/schematic/follower leveling system along with an incredibly diverse and detailed research/skill tree system will undoubtly provide years of fantastic game play. In addition, the daily login rewards are very generous and actually provide useful items. You might think the missions may get repetitious; but the crafting and progression keep you coming back for more! ~ Enjoy!

body: Unlike 90% of the reviews here, I am going to try to give an actual review. PvP is fun with friends, but can be frustrating at times (but what games arn't?). There are some problems, like odd hit detection and a very steep learning curve. For a free to play game however (or partly free anyway), this is incredibly good. I love the style of the game as well. Most games in this genre all want to be realistic, but this one takes a chaotic cartoony approach that feels and plays very differently then the other games in the genre (For reference, I have played H1Z1 and PuBG). If you want a realistic experience, then this is not the game for you. Otherwise, I would recommend trying it out at least. Personally, I enjoy the alternate game modes best like 50v50. I recommend playing with friends, as playing alone can be boring at times. Oh, and did I mention cross play? I often play this game on PC with friends on Xbox or mobile. You can't play with PSN players sadly.
title: An actual review of the game (PvP)

body: Ok, I've seen so many 1 star reviews that are poorly made and barely given out any reasons why they dislike this game. If they dislike Fortnite, then fine. I don't blame them, it's their opinion. But like always, plz don't judge a game because of the community/fandom, that will lead toxic hatedoms to appear. But without that being said, let's talk about the things what I like and dislike about Fortnite. The pros: The building mechanic, the art style, the iconic emotes, the item store, (at least it's not p2w) the outfits/character customization system, the gunplay, and killing someone and collecting there loot. The cons: The gameplay is shallow, it's unbalanced, the annoying shotguns, sometimes there's glitches, and it's repetitive. (Overall) Fortnite: Battle Royale could've been great, but it's not. I am glad that its popular, but it's a little disappointing but it isn't bad. (Final Verdict) 6/10 needs some work. (Edit: So I've played Save the world mode, and it's very good.)
title: It could've been great, but needs improvements.

body: I purchased this game twice. Once on Xbox and once on pc. I signed into my epic games account on booth, but was unable to play on pc. body: Do you watch Rick and Morty? If so, this game is not for you. This game is directed for the high school sports ball players, i.e. the intellectually challenged. Battle Royale mode is clearly plagiarised from PUBG's avant-garde game designs, which gets its inspiration from gambling. Statistically, the odds of winning a game of Battle Royale is the same as getting a doctorate from Harvard - a more prestigious and respectable achievement. The cartoony art style displays its immature appeal. Furthermore, the character designs show off how well Epic Games can objectify women. A pure luck-based experience to cash out on the battle royale craze. The Save the World story mode features unimaginative situations. It started out with an interesting premise. A mysterious outbreak has taken over the world, and you team up with a crew of wacky robots to drive them back. And then nothing happens. You're running the same missions ad nauseam, and landscapes are all the same with no sense of progression.
title: A game for non intellectuals...

body: PVP BATTLE ROYALE MODE: I've Noticed some people complaining about Fortnight's BR VS Pubg's BR and i wanted to explain a few points 1.Fortnight's BR is far better at this point at fixing problems and bringing updates out while Pubg has a harder time at it 2.Fortnights BR is focused on building mechanics while Pubg is more focused on vehicles meaning more drive by shootings 3.Fortnights BR Has a Smaller map and because of that you get more action while Pubg has a larger map meaning. less action 4.Fortnights BR although cartoony has better graphics in the long haul then Pubgs more realistic style 5.Fortnights BR gliders are more fun and useful then pubgs not so well done parachutes 6.Fortnights BR weapons are simple pick up and shoot weapons while Pubgs weapons are reasonably complex with lots of different. attachments and fire rate modes 7. Fortnight BR is FREE while Pubg costs $30.00 Both are fun just depends on your play style

body: My issues here really aren't much with the game itself. Game has a cool visual style to it, I'm a big fan of the ability to just build fortifications when, where, and how you want. Some mechanics take a little getting used to, but not the worst learning curve I've encountered. No, my issues begin and end with the fact that they are selling a closed beta to a free to play game for $60. Basically what they are selling you is $60 worth of in-game purchases, and you are paying them to beta test their game for them. It's a kickstarter campaign marketed as a full game. This brings me to what really bothers me, and it is that in none of their marketing did they make clear that this is only a beta, nor were they upfront about this being destined for free-to-play status. Even on this page that fact is barley a footnote. I would probably feel different if they had been more transparent about what this really is, or they didn't charge a full $60. Again, not a horrible game, but not worth the fee.
title: $60 Closed beta for a free to play game?

body: *Review of Battle Royale and Save the World* Fortnite has two game modes, a paid PvE, Save the World, and a free 100 player PvP, Battle Royale. I will refer to the modes as STW and BR in this review. Although I really don't like this game, I will still give an honest, unbias review. To start off, STW is more for a player with time to give, while BR is just something to play when your bored or for a player who just wants pure action. I really don't like how Epic Games focuses primarily on the BR game mode, for example, all of the screenshots for the game is the BR map. Another example is that they changed the whole game's name to "Fortnite Battle Royale." STW deserves more attention considering BR probably wouldn't exist if STW was never made. The building feature creates a unique aspect of Fortnite, making it a very popular and competitive game for most ages. Overall, Epic Games does a great job at keeping their game relevant with the weekly content updates and interesting map changes.
title: 3 stars, here's why.

body: Any game made by Epic is epic at first then slowly dies. A good example is the Gears franchise and now this. This game has SO MANY unbalanced mechanics that its more RNG/spam based than skill based. Don't believe me, find the compact SMG (P90) or anything automatic using small ammo. New to the game or don't play enough? GREAT! You'll run into more sweaty, build god players who play this game almost 24/7 that you won't be able to learn the game because you'll be dying so much (hiding all game doesn't help either). Oh and if you already know how to play, GREAT! You'll have a boring build off of who can build faster than just height advantage the enemy player. You like the skins and emotes? Pay $5-$20 for them EACH. This game is popular because of streamers/youtubers possibly being paid by Epic games to promote it. Btw, if you didn't know, Fortnite BR has made 1 Billion+ dollars in a year so its very possible; otherwise, not many players would be playing this. TL;DR - DON'T INSTALL!

body: Now I have played other royale game like The Culling, and PUBG, but none compare to Fortnite. Why? Well, you jump out of a flying vehicle and land somewhere on a well thought out, highly detailed island. You stock up on loot and start killing other unfortunate players who crossed paths with you. Collect building materials so you can defend yourself, and others if you play Duos and Squads. With all this happening, a huge barrier, (The Storm) closes in on all 100 players. If you win, you get a message saying #1 Victory Royale! And the all-to-well-known umbrella. Repeat! I mainly like Fortnite because of the strategy used. When you die, you can learn your mistakes like "I didnt build" or "I forgot crouching makes you accurate". Really the only thing I dont like are Fortnite trolls, but those are rare. That was my opinion. I hope it helped!
title: Royale of Royales

body: I started this game about a week after season 3 started, and instantly fell in love. This game was amazing and fun in every aspect, and then Epic started listening to the Season 4 and 5 noobs. Then next thing you know the shotguns are nerfed, then gathering materials is nerfed and so is editing, double shotty, and wall/structure health. THEY EVEN INCREASED BLOOM ON MOST WEAPONS! Then here comes the SMG'S. This SMG meta has torn apart the game more then anything. And the fact that their is no double shotty to counter it is sad, very sad. Building is what made this game unique and fun, and it was just about the only skill gap in the game. Now it doesn't even matter how fast you build or who is the better builder, it's about who has the better SMG and who gets lucky with there bloom shots. Literally it's making games shorter because their is rarely any build fights anymore. Not to mention that shotguns are completely garbage now. I am probably gonna start playing Realm Royale for now on

body: I am a large fan of Minecraft. I have known about and played the game for many years now. I always loved the game. I bought the Java edition (twice) and the PE version. The Java edition was great, I got everything I wanted and more. The PE edition was good, but it didn't feel too fun. When I heard that Windows 10 edition was coming out, I felt optimistic for the future (plus I basically had two free copies from the Java versions I bought). It was nice, but didn't live up to my expectations. Now I see that there are micro-transactions everywhere. This is exactly the direction I didn't want the game to go. Locking down the community and making you pay for everything. Microsoft is forcing everyone to leave the Java edition, by making every other version compatible with one another, except for good old Java. Buy the Java version, since you can play on Windows 10 with it, but also because it comes with a free copy of Windows 10. TL;DR: Buy the Java version. You can thank me later.
title: Buy Java

body: I've spent years watching Minecraft videos on YouTube, so I was very excited when I purchased Minecraft for myself and began playing it. And while it's very fun, there's still TONS of room for improvement in the Windows 10 Edition. While calling this particular version "stripped down" might be unfair, I've learned (the hard way) that this edition is based off of the earlier Pocket Edition of Minecraft, which lacks many of the features of the original PC Edition. What I'd really like to see added to Minecraft: Windows 10 are more options that enable people with slower PCs to play the game without worrying about big performance issues. (Minecraft, after all, is a surprisingly resource-demanding game!) That's the main thing I'd like to see added to this edition, but there are also other changes I'd like to see made. Some of the block/item types (stained glass, for example) and structures (woodland mansions, for example) should really be added to future updates to improve gameplay.
title: Room For Improvement

One thing that left me wanting though was controller compatibility. I had an xbox controller but to use it with Minecraft, I had to use 3rd party programs, which were a pain to work with. Alas, we have the perfect combination of a full Minecraft game, with the simplistic menus of the tablet version, and the controller option that I've been wanting all along! It's good so far! 1 thing though. When I pause the game, I expect everything to freeze right when I hit pause. Save me from a quick death or maybe just going out to type a review. body: I have played Minecraft for 5 years (since 1.2.5) and I absolutely love the game. While the original version is overall superior, in terms of optimization, The Windows 10 Edition is far superior to the original version. Another thing I love about this version is the user-friendliness. Although I know how to setup a server for the original version of Minecraft, I appreciate how this version is extremely easy to use for the newcomers to the game. Just start a world and boom, you instantly have a server that others can play on (even people with Pocket Edition can join too!) the while on the original version it can be a bit more annoying at times. However, it is lacking modding and some features from the original version. Also, having to pay for texture packs is egregious and ridiculous (texture packs on the original are free). Once it gets the features from the original version, it will be the quintessential version of Minecraft because of the incredible optimization.

body: This runs much more smoothly than the Java version. Obviously the first Beta version is barely different from Pocket Edition (which it is ported from), but we'll quickly see improvements. One such example of this is in the GUI for the survival inventory, crafting table, and stone cutter. They resemble the PC version more than pocket edition. If they do similar things for the other GUIs, like the furnace and chests, it will be much better. There are optimizations to the GUI in general that they could make, but it's hard to say in the first Beta what they will change. There are many complaints about redstone (which isn't in Pocket Edition yet, so they'll have to add it to this version separately), and a bunch of little complaints about things that they will hopefully change. I expect huge updates in the near future that greatly increase the playability of this version. Go easy on the reviews. This was just released to public beta.
title: Lots of potential

body: UPDATE: Still having a wonderful time! Texture packs would be a definite bonus as well, but for the love of god, implement the 3D anaglyph already! PREVIOUS: (x86 systems are finally supported!) After reading negative reviews, I figured I would install Minecraft: Windows 10 Edition (Beta) to test it out. I really don't see what all the fuss is about! I LOVE this version. It's simplified, yet a fully functional version of Minecraft: skin packs, servers, Nether support, etc. The user interface is clean, and I really enjoy the new features that are integrated into this version. However, it would be nice to see some support for developers who want to publish mods, or some integration for a mod pack store. Whether Mojang and/or Microsoft will include this feature is beyond me, but I hope it happens. Nonetheless, I sense good things to come in the future. What a fantastic start!

It runs nicely on my dual core machine, startup is faster than the desktop version, and it is easier to switch between the game and other windows. When my kids play the desktop version, I often have to get involved to do some kind of tech support. The Windows 10 Edition is so much cleaner and easier to get started. It is easier to for them to get a multiplayer game going too. I enjoy not having to get involved. It ties in to XBOX Live nicely.

body: I got this for free from owning the PC version, and for the price it isn't bad. Keep in mind it is still a beta, but I think it has a lot of potential, the tablet-like UI is just a starting point. The biggest selling point for me is that it runs on Microsoft's new DirectX12. The potential performance improvements are astronomical. Simply the fact that it runs on a native Windows library and not JVM should spell out huge performance improvements. I hope they update it to include full PC features, but for now, it's good. I look forward to seeing what it looks like out of the beta.
title: Finally DirectX Minecraft

body: Odličan port Minecrafta za Windows 10. To je ustvari MCPE (Pocket Edition) i zato možete igrati sa nekim ko koristi Android ili iOS, a uskoro i Xbox One, PS4 i Nintendo Switch sa novim cross-play updateom. Još uvijek nema baš SVE funkcije i blockove kao Java verzija zato što je igra još uvijek u Beta fazi razvoja, ali će ubrzo imati sve kao Java verzija. Minecraft Store je također jako zanimljiva ekskluzivna funkcija ove verzije (zajedno sa MCPE) i to je jako dobar način za ulaganje u Minecraft community i način za ljude koji prave mape, teksture, skinove itd. da zarade novac za svoj rad i trud što im omogućava da prave još više sadržaja. Besplatan kod uz Java verziju je jako dobrodušno od Microsofta i dobar je način za promociju ove verzije igre. Kao i svaka igra, i ova ima bugova, ali developeri su jako brzi i izbacuju česte update-e. Sve u svemu ovo je jako zabavna igra koja će vam pružiti jako mnogo zabave i zadovoljstva i to je razlog što sam je ocijenio sa 5 zvjezdica! :D

body: Missing a lot of features, but it's BETA, something that a lot of people around here seem to forget. I've owned the game since it's alpha days and was pleased to see a free code for the Windows 10 version here. The first thing you'll notice is that the game isn't running in the old Java client, which is already a good first step. I hope to see more features added to this version besides the intended vanilla features, perhaps we can get some cross-platform multiplayer going on with Xbox One? Many of the negative reviews I see complain about in-app purchases (limited to skins, but you still have the option to import your own skins for free) and even more of the negative reviews treat this game as a finished product. Again, this is BETA. It's an unfinished product. It says BETA in the title, but let's be honest here. Microsoft can't possibly label it large enough for colorful enough to make it obvious to these people that it's a work in progress. Ignore the 1-star reviews.

body: Minecraft is great because you can do so much with it. It can be exciting with fighting some of the mobs for the first time on a world. It can give you a sense of adventure when you explore the terrain and caves. It allows you to express yourself with building. It can even be relaxing if you tend a farm, or decide to dig up an entire area. Or you could simply blow it all up if you choose. The possibilities truly are endless, which is why I can always come back to playing Minecraft and sink so many hours into it. The Java edition has historically been ahead with features, and while that is still true at the time of writing, this edition (Bedrock) has been catching up quickly over the past few months. On top of that, the biggest advantage it has over the Java edition is that you can play with your Xbox friends on the same world, which as a streamer and content creator helps me connect with more people in my community, which I love!

body: This is a great game, but there are so many idi*ts sending out bad reviews. Any person who says "it should be free," or "it's not the real thing," are just dumba**es and should not be listened to. All of these reasons have answers to them. 1. Mojang needs money to pay their employees to basically code/develop/improve/fix Minecraft Win10/PE. If this was free they would need to stop making Minecraft Win/PE. 2. This is a port Minecraft PE (Pocket Edition) for Windows 10. The description even says this is not Minecraft Java Edition! Go on the Minecraft wiki if you want too! Minecraft PE is a version of Minecraft in C++, a much faster programming language than Java. Mojang says that they will roll out updates on Java BEFORE PE/Win10 THEN they will apply them to other versions. That's why Java has more features! But Win10/PE are now not that far apart, and now you can barely tell the differences.
title: This is a great game, but don't listen to these idi*ts

body: I usually play the Java version of Minecraft because of the features and mods, but this version (C++) is still fun and runs great on mobile devices. I had Minecraft PE on my iPhone and iPad but it is great to have this version on my Surface Pro and desktop. There is cross platform play so you can join servers with people playing on iOS or android OS's. The game is similar to the Java version in many aspects and different in others. I understand it is meant for mobile and therefore there is a lack of graphics settings, except from fast to fancy, but since they are pushing this with Windows 10, many people have powerful gaming PC's and would like to change the settings to take advantage of their hardware. I would recommend this game and if you already own the Java version then it is free, just sign into you Mojang account on their website and enter your code in the windows store. Not a replacement for Java Minecraft but definitely worth trying out!
title: Great Game for Desktop and Mobile Alike!

body: The poor reviews are uncalled for. Clearly, there are features missing and some problems. Overall, very impressed thus far. Positive: VERY smooth scrolling, clean textures, distance viewing goes for miles without killing your system, and most of all..the tie into your Live account is fantastic. Very easy dl and account mgt. Friends connectivity through Live is also fantastic. Great start! Needs improvement: Absolutely need dedicated server and more stable multi-play. It does tend to crash or lag at times for those connecting. (just 2 intranet struggled at times) MC is supposed to be a real-time world. You can't just shutdown and nothing happens. I want to come back and see my wheat grown and my town nuked by creepers. I do eventually want to see plugin/mod capability. These are the lifeblood of MC and keep the interest level up.
title: Smooth, simplified but needs dedicated server

body: I love how you can seamlessly switch from controller to keyboard. It feels like I can switch at the drop of a hat. I love all of the block options that are available all in one place. I love how it looks and runs on my pc, and that all of the custom options are there for when you want to customize your game. It seems like this will be a fantastic version of the game when it gets fully released. However, a huge complaint I have is that you can't customize controls yet. I'm a left handed person who can't use my right hand very well except for easy tasks, so generally I like to move my character with the arrow keys using my right hand and do everything else with my left. Also there are a few things that make it hard to use the controller as well, but that may just be me not used to a new layout yet. So for now the game is a bit awkward and challenging to play physically. I'll keep trudging on because I absolutely love minecraft, but please work on this feature soon so I can play fully.
title: It's great for a beta...

body: Although it still has a long way to go before it can supplant the standard Java version, this version of Minecraft has a lot of promise. The performance is much better than the Java version, and the developers keep adding new features. Although the features lag behind normal Minecraft somewhat at the time of this writing, I look forward to a day when it catches up with the Java version (and hopefully adds mod support as well). It's a great pastime! I'm a bit bummed that it doesn't have cross-buy with my Windows Phone and with Xbox One, but perhaps that will be fixed when it leaves beta. It also doesn't sync with the cloud, but it's not enough of an issue for me to remove a star.

body: Minecraft means everything to me and the people who play Minecraft as well. Minecraft has helped me and probably millions of people out in the world today. When I'm sad, I build something that's gets my mind off the pain, of course the game has a few bad things but there is still the bright side about the game. body: I love the fact that this is almost exactly like the original PC and Pocket Edition versions of Minecraft; however, it gets rid of many essential features that me and many of my friends at school use. I introduced Minecraft to many of my friends at school, and purchased over fifty accounts for each of them. We developed our own custom controls for us to use, but Minecraft Windows 10 Beta Edition does not have an option to set custom keyboard controls like PC version does. Many of us prefer to play Minecraft Windows 10 Beta Edition on our Surfaces or PCs over cellphone because we love the keyboard options; however, we cannot play it fluently because of the lack of control options. Other than that, this game is excellent! It's fast! It's fun! It's Addictive!
title: A Few Essential Options are Missing

body: I love that this game can run great on low end pcs unlike the java version, and I love the cross platform play and controller support. Also, when my items disappear, so do my sisters, (we play cross platform over LAN, me on my pc and her on my NVIDIA shield portable.) and we both lost all of our items. but when this glitch does not happen, it is a blast to play. Also, it would be good for a different chest interface for controller/keyboard and mouse, and the xbox crafting interface for controller only. body: This is actually surprisingly a decent version of the game. More updated than the console version anyway. HOWEVER.. my one major annoyance is the touch screen mode. I'm playing on a surface pro, and for the most part, the touch controls work fine. But there's some minor problems that irritate me a lot. For example, it uses the PC crafting menu, which is fine and all, but it's not set up well for touch screen users. There's no easy way to pick up or drop a single item out of a stack, making crafting stupidly tedious. Some kind of auto-crafting menu like the console version or android version would be nice. At least as an option. Or at the very least making picking up single items out of a single stack easier. Another minor annoyance with touch screen controls, is that you can't manually move the controls around onscreen. The d-pad is a bit too low. I keep getting to close to the bottom of the screen when I press down. You also can't disable auto-jump when touch screen mode is on.

body: Updated (again)): As said previously, this game runs wonderfully better than the traditional Java version of the game, keeps most elements while doing so, and tops it off with multiple ways to play the game (touch, keyboard/mouse, gamepad). Minus the frequent crashes, with the new updates the game has been having, the UI is now mostly migrated from the Pocket Edition's elements, making the game feel much better. There is an instant switch between touch/keyboard/gamepad, for when you press a button or preform an action the game instantly adjusts to what device you just used. This is useful for switching to a controller if you want to relax. Now that I have an Xbox 360 controller to play around with, using it with Minecraft: Windows 10 Edition was almost flawless. The only thing I noticed that could be a possible downside was the sluggish inventory navigation, since Crafting is a thing. Sprinting was also difficult as it didn't have its own designated button. That's about it.

body: After the Windows 10 Creators update Minecraft crashes on launch. I get the Mojang logo, and then *poof*, nothing. All the drivers are up to date, the game is up to date, and zero help from Microsoft. their solution is to do a clean install of Windows 10 and then when that doesn't work, I am supposed to uninstall all my programs and then try reinstalling them one at a time until I find the problem. Yeah, see, I have over 3tb of games and programs on this machine and deleting them would require 400 hours of downloads to get them all back. That's two-and-a-half weeks of letting my computer sit their and do nothing but download to fix a problem that I didn't have before the update screwed everything up. Also, not a fan of how every time the game client updates I get giant chunks of my map moved around. Nothing makes your jungle base look better than a 40 brick high, 200 brick long chunk of random biome where my farm used to be.

body: The controls worked fine for me and the game ran perfectly normally (i7 4720HQ and 960M), menus look like they'd work fine with touch (I was using Mouse and Keyboard). A few things are inconsistent with the PC version that seem interesting: selecting blocks from the creative menu gives 32 rather than one and you slow down far more quickly in creative flight compared to the PC version. Also, quitting the game should be more intuitive. The Windows 10 fullscreen app system is relatively new to the average user (me) and at first glance you can't see any way to quit the game correctly until you try to move the mouse to the top (hopefully an easy fix). Aside from that the game is quite playable and the world export feature is very nice.

body: While the speed and boats saw improvements, the gui and item selections saw downgrades. The gui is harder to navigate due to is layout and functionality is based more for a tablet than a Win 10 PC. The graphics are a bit smoother, the game renders a little faster, and boats are actually usable (they were tricky to operate in the PC version). One thing I miss is the variety of blocks and the ability to add mods that were in the PC version. It would also be nice to import my favorite Minecraft PC world in to the Win 10 Ed. I also think having a variety of locked skins that cost $.99 each to unlock is a little tacky. I have it installed, and I won't uninstall it, but I probably will wait for it to improve dramatically before picking it up again. In all fairness, if I had a Win 10 tablet, and was sitting in a waiting room somewhere this would probably be a good distraction. Since I have a PC that is relatively powerful however, this edition seems like a step backward.
title: Needs improvement

body: As far as content is concerned, this port of Minecraft is interoperable with the pocket edition (unless you're running a version of PE older than ~0.12). Because it's written in C++, this version of Minecraft runs quite smoothly on old 1st generation i5 CPUs (like the 520M) and even older Core2 duo CPUs. I've even gotten good results on an Atom CPU in a Stream7 tablet by HP. I'd like to see this kind of performance in a version that would interoperate with the Java-based Minecraft. All that said, it's pretty rock-solid for a beta and I haven't encountered any glitches or erratic behavior to speak of other than one where the game displays the Mojang splash screen and then it quits without giving any error message on my Dell e5540 laptop running Windows 10 x64 (even after a clean reinstall). Aside from that, I have no complaints and my only request is the ability to have parity with the Java version & the ability to connect to servers.
title: Well-written port but crashes on Dell e5540

Second, I can only assume the game runs smoothly because the frames are locked at (what I can only guess at because there is no way to access a counter) substantially below 60 frames with no option to turn it up. body: First off, just bc a game is in early access and has a $30 price tag doesn't mean you can get away with the multitude of issues. This game is enjoyable and fun, especially with friends, but otherwise it's an absolute mess. The fps is consistently low, the pop in is awful, the overall graphics and textures are that of 2 generations ago, the button layout is subpar, the game constantly crashes, and the aiming/shooting mechanics are infuriating. I get it's early access, but it still shouldn't be this poorly ported, and shouldn't be heavily marketed to trick unaware casuals and parents into sales, as that can be problematic. I do enjoy it and am patient for future updates/fixes, but i still have to give my honest 2 cents in the present. If you don't care about bugs and enjoy having fun then try this game.. otherwise wait for a few updates.

body: THIS IS A GAME PREVIEW! It will have bugs. It will crash. They are working and updating to make it better. Don't get mad when you pay for a game preview and it crashes. Be supportive, and understanding. If you encounter errors, go to their forums and let them know the issues you have. Leaving 1 star reviews just because it crashed is childish. Rate on the gameplay and the fun you have while it is working. Think of this as an alpha test, just open to whomever supports them by buying the game preview. The gameplay is fun. Love the option to run around in vehicles, grab backpacks to carry more, and being able to loot other players. If your in a squad, a microphone is highly recommended. I have had alot of fun with random people, even with the game crashing for them and me. Alot of times you can load right back into the match, and if you have a good squad to keep you alive, get right back into the action. I am excited and can't wait to see their finished project. 4/5 stars! Keep it up!👍
title: Read Description Before Buying/Rating!

body: Wonderful gameplay, all 3 playable game modes are lots of fun alone or with friends. The game is a pretty intense battle royale title and is decently competitive too. The most recent patch (I'm on the regular old Xbox One) has reduced "rubberbanding" when moving and network lag in my experience. Less frequently (at least 1/5 of matches in my experience) but consistently, a lot of players still experience the entire game crashing. I am updating from 2 of 5 stars to 3 of 5 for the moment. I would now currently recommend purchasing PUBG if the crashing in the meantime doesn't bother you. The devs have made making the game crash-free one of their top priorittes for 2018, so hopefully it continues to improve.
title: (Update) Lag is not hurting the game as badly anymore

body: I've always preferred PUBG for a Battle Royale experience due to the game's emphasis on realism and gear/weapon variety rather than it being arcady and cartoony (which is the reason why I don't like Fortnite) and overall, I've had a relatively good experience playing this game but however, I'm not going to deny that this game has some MAJOR issues that will surely hurt it's reputation. The first and most obvious issue is the Frame Rate. A match usually starts off with really bad FPS that averages at around 15 or so smoothing out a minute after you land on the ground. This can get pretty annoying and can cause one to get killed and lose. The other being the poor latency and crashes. You can be hiding behind a tree, boulder, or a corner of a building and still get shot and every now and then, the game will instantly crash leaving you to be a sitting duck. I get that PUBG is in Game Preview but first impressions matter especially when they're going against Fortnite which is FREE. 3/5

body: Today, PUBG is at the top of the charts in terms of BR-style games, and for good reason. But I feel on Xbox it has been given more praise than deserved. I understand that the game is in early access, but it's been advertised so much, and in such a way, as if it's a full release. I mean, we even have a PUBG Xbox One bundle now. A bundle including a game that is incomplete and riddled with bugs and performance issues. The average consumer is unaware the game is in as incomplete a state as it is, which is why the game receives about as many complaints as it does compliments. As often stated, PUBG suffers from pretty poor optimization, causing inconsistent framerate (often dropping very low), lag and rubberbanding, and general graphical bugs. Couple this with buggy physics and a strange control scheme, often made worse by the other problems and recurring input lag. All these issues aside, I still play and enjoy the game. I would however highly recommend the PC version over this any day.
title: Still Needs a Lot of Fixing

body: PUBG has become one of my most liked/played game in the past months. The evolution of this game since it’s release has been amazing. The way that the games developers take criticism from the community to improve the experience the game delivers is relieving. The close quarter combat cannot be mimicked, the heart clenching final moments of the final circles, and the rewarding feeling of a chicken dinner are aspects of this game that stick out to me and drive me back to it! I reccomend this game to anyone who enjoys a challenge of both awareness and skill. If you enjoy pushing yourself to dominate the battlefield, this game is for you. If you enjoy occasionally hitting your team mates with a car, this game is also for you. The only thing I would improve with the game is a consistency with weapons in structures. I would also have to say let the community have access to custom servers so more content can be pushed out into the community!
title: Experience PUBG!

body: long review ahead. First off there are a lot of cons to this game. The framerate is maybe 25-30 on xbox one x and even that is a maybe, while it is even worse on the regular Xbox one often probably hitting lower than 20. No matter how good your internet is you will lag at some point, i generally do a lot. The beginning is the worst about lagging which is bad because that's when you need to loot fast. As far as crashing goes I've played around 25 matches and have only crashed once and got right back in since i was in a house, but again I'm playing on the one x. The game also has a problem with hit detection which is why you can swear you shot someone but nothing happened. I can forgive crashes and lag due to early access but i can't forgive not having the option to play private matches. Before anyone shouts early access, full pc version came out recently and only some streamers have the option to create them. Why 3 stars then? gameplay is adrenaline pumping especially if you make top 10

body: I started playing PUBG around the end of February 2018, but as of November 2018, I am no longer playing PUBG anymore due to technical problems, performance issues, decline in players including some personal issues I have with Bluehole and their decisions surrounding PUBG. That being said, it was fun while it lasted but like they say "All things must come to an end". And if PUBG has issues running on an XB1X, which has 12GB GDDR5 Memory and a faster CPU/GPU, then I hope Sony fans don't get their hopes up... Lol! The PS4 Pro runs on 8GB GDDR5 Memory with a slower and less powerful CPU/GPU, so for those whose thinking it's going to run better... It's NOT!!! The standard PS4 will run the same as the XB1S, with all of the same exact problems. However, I was really hoping that Bluehole and Microsoft was going to stick together, but my hopes for PUBG remaining an Xbox Exclusive for consoles, was a let down and a huge disappointment for me! I hope Microsoft releases a BR Xbox Exclusive. 🤞

body: Ok, so I'm gonna be completely honest here. I have pretty bad internet and this game still runs honestly smoother than I though it was gonna run! I've only encountered a few problems with little lag spikes sometimes and some rendering issues when you first drop into the map, other than that, a few black screens that dashboarded me (but most times you can load back in if you're quick), clunky controls (which I got used to so now they aren't bad), the game is fun as'f! Now the game is still in early access, I know, but It has a good system setup with plenty of cousomization and loot to find on the battlefield, plus loot crates you can purchase to customize your character more! The gitches it has will be sorted soon I'm sure but like I said, not that many I've had a problem with. I'm enjoying the game a ton as it is so I'm excited to see this game progress with updates/content over the coming months! Thanks and PEACE 🔥

body: This is honestly one of the worst modern era games I've played and that is taking into account that it's a preview. Graphics are mediocre, the map is extremely generic and uninspired and you will spend much of your time rubberbanding around it or just getting flat out dropped from matches. The controls, menus, map, and inventory are among the least intuitive and least user friendly I've ever seen. Many issues like shots not registering or hitting feet away from your reticle even at close range, sounds like cars and gunfire can't be heard unless you're facing the direction it came from even when it's right next to you, doors near you opening and closing instead of picking up the gear you are looking at, and other general coding issues. You'll often feel like you completely wasted your time at the end of a match. For a game that was in beta on PC since March 17', they should be embarrassed at the state of the game. With the exception of the concept, literally no positives at this time.
title: Horrible even for a preview. (2/15/18)

body: Playerunknowns is an fun and addicting game to say the least. I have put in over 1500 Hours on PC and Xbox put together and can say without a doubt it is worth the 30$ price tag. The good - PUBG is a great game to play solo, or with friends providing amazing replay value. The skill ceiling is nearly limitless always allowing for the player to improve and polish their skills. The slow paced, strategic gameplay allows for players to play the way they want whether it be passive or hyper aggressive. Personally I love that each game can play out so much differently than the last allowing for unique experiences every time. The bad - 30 fps, small bugs/glitches, aiming will require hours of game play to adjust to if you are used to games with aim assist (COD,Halo,overwatch). The slow roll out of PC updates to Xbox, and (in my opinion) the biggest drawback is no crossplay. overall I love the game and have supported since Alpha I look forward to everything they have in store!
title: Fun, exciting, and action packed!

body: I love the Combat PUBG offers. There's none of that 'Instant Fortress' stuff like Fortnite. While i may find myself saying "How!?" or "Yeah Right!!" most of the time it's due to my own fault. It's a massive learning curve, but once you adapt. You become an efficient fighting machine. Graphically, it's more realistic. Although textures on older consoles look blurry more often, and the 'Inventory screen' has no character. I do enjoy that i can explore most buildings. And audio is accurate for weapon shots, etc. Although it's hard to hear footsteps unless you turn volume high on Headphones. My biggest complaint is the loot and MTs. You will get the same pair of shoes, 100+ times. Your motivation to play, is hopes of something good for once. But now, in a game you already paid for. You have paid event passes like Fortnite. Unlike Fortnite, you can't earn G-Points for playing. So you WILL have to buy the pass, or be stuck with the basic 'Free' rewards. It's fun, just needs better rewards
title: Adrenaline Pumping Gameplay, Needs Better Rewards

body: So after hesitating (and for good reason), I downloaded the game. The FIRST thing I see is "Servers are too busy ,try again later". WTF man really?? So after spamming the "Retry" button, I FINALLY got into a game. Kind of. I didnt even see the spawn island. Instead, im left listening to the plane flying with a black screen to stare at. Then it loads only for me to see the plane is already half way across the map. Awesome. So I jump out, land and get stuck in a rendering building for 1 minute. Again, awesome. It FINALLY loads and I gear up a little bit. I come across an enemy, shoot him and nothing happens. He shoots back, I die. Ok I figured, first game and im new here so its cool. Well apply this same exact scenario a second time. And then a third time. I couldnt even attempt a 4th because the servers wont load. I tried to give it the benefit of the doubt, but I feel like Bluehole just robbed me. New map?? How about fixing the game instead of adding more content we cant use!!

body: PUBG had great potential, and could have easily been a 5 star game, but it doesn't live up to the hype. For starters, the crashing. It is inevitable, no matter how good your console runs, this game will crash at the worst times. Then theres the movement. Its spotty, laggy, and can have you running in place for minutes at a time as you try to grab one item. Then there's solo mode. Solo mode is alright up until you hit the top 20, then everyone is just driving around trying to get a splatter kill. I payed $30 for PUBG, not an updated buggier version of Carmegeddon. The game still has loads of potential, but as of right now, save yourself some time and frustration, and buy a different game. PUBG needs time to develop further.

body: With the number of units sold and the overall popularity of this game, it's quite baffling that the game was released in its current state. When/if the game "works", it is quite fun and fairly easy to look over the plethora of bugs that exist. Crashing multiple times in a single session is a little more difficult to look past. I've played most of the available preview games available on the xbox, several costing less money, that are far more polished than PUBG. Hopefully the money made from the not so subtle cash grab port goes towards the game that so many people are supporting. It could easily be a 4 or 5 star game if some more time goes into it. 1992 graphics and single digit frame rates aside, this game is oodles of fun. Also, stop selling $5 cosmetic items and maybe focus on fixing the game instead.

body: Buy this game NOW its $20.09 on sale instead of $29.99 regular. 0 complaints for a $20 game. Game crashing has been significantly reduced to the point that the crashes resulting from extended play sessions may be gone or almost entirely. Make sure you uninstall and then 'fresh install' after every single game update. I've played PUBG nearly every single day since December 2017 and have not lost hope on it. Have some patience you crybabies, they ARE fixing it, even if they do sometimes seem a bit handicapped. As of June 28th 2018, PUBG on original Xbox One with wired connection, (if you use wifi then everything is your own fault), is in a much better state of playability, but that does not go without saying that the frame rate needs to be improved to 30fps or preferably better (please give us 60fps), and any or all of the lag spikes need that may be remaining need to be smoothed out. TL; DR; Play PUBG, its still addicting & tolerable now; you whinos can stop crying.

body: This game is beyond amazing and incredibly realistic, right down to the gun fights which turn into a chess match on the fly. Thats all it is: one big mind game everytime you spawn in. Nothing is done without a reason and these tricks take hours to practice which is what makes this game so amazing, BUT also its downfall (for new players). This game is unforgiving if youre clueless, you have to rely on wits and outsmart the enemy at every aspect. Aspects such as map knowledge, operators, weapons/equipment, game mechanics, etc. The only way to learn this is to duke it out and keep playing until you get ahead of the curve, and trust me youll feel rewarded when you get it down. All in all, new players: dont let this tough game scare you off, theres just a lot to learn but have patience and youll get it! (You can always Youtube tricks/tips too lol)
title: High Learning Curve

body: This game is like a drug; it is fun. The multiplayer is fun and I rarely find toxic players. The game feels balanced and destructability gives the gamer the option to be creative. There are also more than 20+ operators so the game never feels the same. It also encourages communication as some situations require you to talk to teammates. As much as I love Rainbow there are a few flaws. The game is pretty difficult as a new player. Ranked in this game is broken (but should be fixed soon) and the game is prone to crashes and disconnection. It is also kind of dumb that you need to buy two season passes. If Ubisoft could fix this the game would be a lot better. Otherwise, the game usually plays really well. If this game's issues can be fixed, it would get 5 stars. I HIGHLY recommend this game to anybody looking to try a new tactical shooter.

body: Hands down my most played game I own on any of my platforms but the matchmaking mechanics prevent it from being 5 stars. I can not count the number of times I have been kicked from an online ranked match to then not be given the option to rejoin. In any other game I'd shrug it off but in this one you lose ranking and get hit with a 15 minute ban for their poor servers. Speaking of the servers, they are pretty frequently down (like today), or having maitenance being done which is pretty frustrating for a game that has no campaign and is almost completely multiplayer only. All that said, I will be playing this game until those servers crash completely or are turned off because I only hate all the server issues because it prevents me from being able to play more.

body: I've played R6S on and off for awhile. The game has interesting maps, Operators, and unlockables. A lot of things are very expensive and focused a bit more towards paying actual money for it. Which i'm not much of a fan of. I enjoy the destruction of maps with a tactical take on everything. However none of this really matters in the end. When a game is focused around Multiplayer, it is the Community that really determines if the game is fun or not. First two matches today. First round, before i could move i get Team Killed. Second Round, i get Team Killed preparing the position. Third round, TK'd by same guy who then gets kicked/Leaves. Voting to kick them, instead 3/4 people vote to kick me. Completely new match. I haven't even moved yet, and because i'm simply talking i already have 2/4 people voting to kick me. All i said "Lets do this". The community makes this game far from enjoyable. Unless you play with friends, half the time you're getting TK'd no matter your skill Lvl.

body: Rainbow six siege is a really fun game to play wheither you're competitive or a casual player. It is mainly a tactical semi slow paced shooter. There is new content, new characters and maps every season. The game leans more towards the competitive side and it is alot of fun with friends, going solo is not as much fun most of the time but there is a strong community for the game so finding players is easy There are also some draw backs to the game for example the game is pleagued with bad servers and hit regisration and net code problems. Matchmaking can also be very frustrating with re joining games you quit or getting stuck at an loading screen and then having to restart the game. 3 years later they still have not fixed these issues and are consentrating more on adding free and paid content instead of fixing the core game first. body: Ubisoft has done it again! Siege has captured the absolute essence of the Rainbow Six franchise and presents the player with fast-paced, tactical, 5v5, close-quarters, round-based combat. The game offers a staggering variety of operators and gadgets that complements nearly every style of gameplay and skill set imaginable and has an almost perfect balance between attacked and defenders resulting in highly competitive rounds when matched with other like-skilled players. Ubisoft's commitment to the game, to date, had been unwavering, offering frequent updates for bug fixes and fresh content each season in the form of new operators, new maps, as well as rebalancing of legacy operators to ensure no single "breaking" operator exists. New players will potentially feel a little intimidated at first given the sheer amount of content in game but will quickly come up to speed. If you're looking for a game that has a perfect blend of strategy, tactics, and plan execution, you've found it!
title: Phenomenal Game! Strategic CQB at it's finest!

body: This game is truly a masterpiece of design. The graphics are incredible, Frames always 60 a second for Online play and the details are amazingly complicated. This game may be $50 dollars, but the game has free play days and goes more than 50% off very frequently. The operators are balanced except for Blitz and Caviera, (Opinion, don't hate). The DLC and cosmetics are somewhat inexpensive and will give you hundreds of hours to kill in competitive gameplay. This shooter is the most realistic and tactical of its kind on the market, so this game should not be your first FPS/Shooter. Rainbow 6 is also very slow-paced, but at the same time goes by very quickly in the heat of the battle. You should know that this game offers a one-shot headshot no respawn type of gameplay, so if you don't want such a hardcore enviroment, perfect realism, and a slow-paced game, you would probably prefer a game like Overwatch. It should be noted that unfortuately 90% of the Siege communtity is crazy toxic 😠
